availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Vincent Weathers Crabb (Christian County, Kentucky, clerk and farmer.)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, clerk and farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Jarred Crabb and Betsy Crabb. Married to Ann "Nannie" Louisa Long Crabb in Christian County, Kentucky, on June 4, 1862. Father of Jared L. Crabb. Clerk in Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Christian County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Christian County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 2, p. 254A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 785.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 312A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 3, p. 516B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film 000465564.
"Vincent Weathers Crabb (1827-1896)," Find A Grave, Memorial 88551668, accessed July 15, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88551668/vincent-weathers-crabb.
